abstract: The new service’s software technology, called Clearflow, is an ambitious attempt to apply machine-learning techniques to the problem of traffic congestion.
snippet: The new service’s software technology, called Clearflow, is an ambitious attempt to apply machine-learning techniques to the problem of traffic congestion.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Microsoft on Thursday plans to introduce a Web-based service for driving directions that incorporates complex software models to help users avoid traffic jams.

headline.main: Microsoft Introduces Tool for Avoiding Traffic Jams
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Introduces Tool For Avoiding Traffic Jams

abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
snippet: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions. The combination, which would join Yahoo, Microsoft’s MSN and News Corporation’s MySpace, would create a behemoth that would upend the Internet landscape.

headline.main: News Corp. May Join Yahoo Bid With Microsoft
headline.print_headline: In Twist, News Corp. Is Talking to Microsoft on Yahoo Bid

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: Outlook Express is set to save my e-mail password and now I do not remember it. Is there an easy way I can find out what it is?
snippet: Outlook Express is set to save my e-mail password and now I do not remember it. Is there an easy way I can find out what it is?
lead_paragraph: Q. I’ve had Outlook Express set to save my e-mail password for so long that now I do not remember what the password was and I did not write it down. Is there an easy way I can find out what it is?

abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to The New York Times. The combination, which would join Yahoo, Microsoft’s MSN and News Corporation’s MySpace, would create a behemoth that would upend the Internet landscape, The Times said.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to The New York Times. The combination, which would join Yahoo, Microsoft’s MSN and News Corporation’s MySpace, would create a behemoth that would upend the Internet landscape, The Times said.

headline.main: News Corp. May Join Yahoo Bid With Microsoft

abstract: CNBC interviews Andrew Ross Sorkin of the Times about discussions that News Corp is having with Microsoft about a joint bid to acquire Yahoo.
snippet: CNBC interviews Andrew Ross Sorkin of the Times about discussions that News Corp is having with Microsoft about a joint bid to acquire Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: CNBC interviews Andrew Ross Sorkin of the Times about discussions that News Corp is having with Microsoft about a joint bid to acquire Yahoo.

headline.main: Murdoch May Join Bid for Yahoo

abstract: What if Microsoft dropped its bid for Yahoo and bought AOL and MySpace instead? One analyst says that may be a better deal than a target that doesn’t want to merge.
snippet: What if Microsoft dropped its bid for Yahoo and bought AOL and MySpace instead? One analyst says that may be a better deal than a target that doesn’t want to merge.
lead_paragraph: The flirtations and betrayals among Internet giants would steam up even the hottest afternoon soap opera. In the latest round, the News Corporation, which had been playing footsie with Yahoo, has jumped into the arms of Microsoft in an effort to break up the pending union of Yahoo and Time Warner’s estranged wife, AOL. Oh yes, Google, which everyone envies, is prodding all this on to keep its rivals in a state of confusion.

headline.main: Is Yahoo the Odd Man Out?
